BH 0940729 3/30/1997 12:00:00 AM ASPIRATION PNEUMONIA . DIS DISCHARGE SUMMARY NAME : STRAPEFREIRE , VATALY C 972-02-46 DISCHARGE DATE : 04/01/97 ASSOCIATED DIAGNOSIS : Dementia ; congestive heart failure . HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS AND REASON FOR HOSPITALIZATION : The patient was a 108-year-old nursing home resident , who was admitted with a two-day history of increased respiratory secretions and a 24-hour history of elevated fever . MEDICATIONS ON ADMISSION : Augmentin 500 mg t.i.d. Sertraline 75 mg q.day . Aspirin 81 mg q.day . Vitamin B12 100 mcg IM q.month . SOCIAL HISTORY : The patient resides in the Pcaer,ter Medical Center , is nonambulatory , and her code status is do not resuscitate / do not intubate . PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : No respiratory distress . Her temperature was 102.2 ; blood pressure 135/64 ; pulse rate 108 ; respirations 24 ; oxygen saturations on room air 94% . The abdomen was non-tender , nondistended , no hepatomegaly , normal bowel sounds . Extremities - 1+ edema ; 2+ pulses . The sodium was 142 ; potassium 4.5 ; chloride 105 ; bicarbonate 27 ; BUN and creatinine 31 and 1.3 ; glucose 107 ; total protein 7.7 ; albumin 3.2 ; globulin 4.5 ; uric acid 4.2 ; alkaline phosphatase 114 ; serum glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase 46 ; lactic acid dehydrogenase 370 ; white blood count 11,000 with 83 polymorphonuclear leukocytes ; hematocrit 42 ; platelet count 227,000 . A chest x-ray showed consolidation bilateral lyin the lower lobes . TR : vgo DD : Acc : Nursing Director Pcaer,ter Medical Center Sco , Ohio
277175072 NVH 10% BODY BURNS Signed Admission Date : 01/03/1997 (1) THIRD DEGREE BURN TO RIGHT HAND AND FOREARM DEBRIDEMENT OF BURN AND APPLICATION OF ARTIFICIAL SKIN HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : The patient is a 59 year old gentleman who experienced a flash burn from grease while working on a stove on the night prior to admission . The patient at that time treated himself symptomatically at home but presented to Roing Hospital on the day after the event and was transferred to the Nimaconwood Valley Hospital immediately for evaluation because of his extensive burns . The patient was walking , talking , and was breathing without difficulty on arrival . No significant history . MEDICATIONS : No known drug allergies . Heart rate 76 , blood pressure 169/100 . The patient was not anxious or ill-appearing . HEENT : Extensive first degree and second degree burns around the face , superficial in nature , with no blistering . His oropharynx was wide open with no evidence of burn . Lungs clear to auscultation bilaterally . Heart : Abdomen : Soft , nontender , nondistended . Extremities : Pulses were intact . No evidence of compartment syndrome . HOSPITAL COURSE : The patient was taken from the emergency room and transferred to the Surgical Intensive Care Unit for airway observation . The patient remained hemodynamically stable with good urine output . While in the Intensive Care Unit the patient was put on delirium tremons prophylaxis with Serax around the clock . There was no evidence while in the hospital . The patient was taken to the operating room on 1/5/97 . The patient tolerated the procedure well . On the day of discharge the patient 's dressing was taken down completely and evaluation of the derma graft was made . The patient was screened by the rehabilitation facility and felt to be an acceptable candidate . DISPOSITION : DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS : Colace 100 mg p.o. b.i.d. , Folate 1 mg q.d. , Artificial Tears 2 drops each eye b.i.d. and p.r.n. , Serax 15 mg p.o. q6h - hold if patient excessively sleepy , Thiamine 100 mg p.o. q.d. , MS - Contin 30 mg p.o.b.i.d. , multivitamin q.d. , MSIR 15 mg p.o. q3-4h p.r.n. pain , and Axid 150 mg p.o. b.i.d. Regular . FOLLOWUP : The patient is to be seen in the burn clinic two days after discharge . The patient was discharged in stable condition . Dictated By : Attending : TELSHEY K. PAP , M.D. BH2 MC084/4189 9441 01/07/97 011248535 PUOMC 1/26/2001 12:00:00 AM Signed Report Status : Signed DISCHARGE SUMMARY UNIT NUMBER : 621-80-19 ADMISSION DATE : 01/26/2001 DISCHARGE DATE : PRINCIPAL DIAGNOSIS : Mitral valve disease . Atrial fibrillation , hypertension , aortic valve disease , family history of coronary artery disease , hypothyroidism , and tobacco use . PRINCIPAL PROCEDURE : Right and left heart catheterization , coronary angiography , and left ventriculogram . She had a history of increasing dyspnea on exertion and shortness of breath , orthopnea , and paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea . There was more involvement of the lateral commissure and mild mitral regurgitation . She is now referred for PMV . MEDICATIONS ON ADMISSION : Synthroid , Vitamin E , Centrum , Potassium supplement , Lasix , Coumadin , Atenolol , and Ginkgo . Chest was clear . First sound was increased but variable intensity , the second sound normally split with an increased P2 . There was no edema and there were good femoral pulses bilaterally . SUMMARY : This was a woman with mitral stenosis referred for PMV . The procedure was deemed to be successful and the patient was ultimately discharged on Coumadin , Plendil , Synthroid , Vitamin E , multivitamin , Ginkgo , Lasix , Potassium supplementation and Atenolol . FOLLOW UP : DWAINCO L. RALLSVERSGACH , M.D. DICTATING FOR : Electronically Signed RENLAN N PLAIN , M.D. _____________________________ RENLAN N PLAIN , M.D. DD : 02/15/2001 8:20 P cc :
